De : testing@esellerpro [mailto:testing@esellerpro.com]
Envoyé : mercredi 16 février 2011 15:36
À : 'Julien Buhagiar'
Objet : Priceminister web services
 
Good afternoon Julien,
We are currently having a few issues with the integration between eSellerPro and PriceMinister, and I was hoping you could help with the following queries?
1. Order 40877978 was cancelled and refunded in eSP, but it is still showing as Accepted on your site. Could you please confirm how we cancel orders using your webservices?
2. I uploaded a file at 12.53 on 16/02/2011, which was a single Clothing item. This overwrote current Clothing listings. Please can you investigate?
3. I uploaded a file at 12.59 on 10/02/2011, this contained an error message ‘Please select a condition level’, even though we had selected one in eSP. The condition selected was VGC.
4. I uploaded a file at 11.05 on 10/02/2011, this contained an error message ‘To create a listing, the import reference number must be provided’. Can you please confirm what this is?
5. I uploaded a file at 13.35 on 16/02/2011, this contained 3 Clothing items. Only 1 image listing is showing on your site, even though all 3 have image URLs attached.
 
Thank you in advance for your help.
 
Regards
 
Barry
 
Commentaire de Laurent Payot [ 17/févr./11 15:15 ]
De : Support Pro [mailto:support.pro@priceminister.com]
Envoyé : jeudi 17 février 2011 15:12
À : 'testing@esellerpro'
Cc : Julien Buhagiar
Objet : RE: eSellerpro - Testing - IMP-8076

Hello Barry,

Just like Julien said for all technical questions feel free to mail us directly at support.pro@priceminister.com.
Here are some answers to your questions:

1 - Attached to this mail you will find an updated documentation about PriceMinister Web Services, and three examples of returned XML flows encountered in validation process.

2 - You sent this file using a profile that's in overwrite mode. You only had profiles in overwrite mode, so I created three "Add" profiles so you can use them to simply add new listings without overwriting your stock. Here are the profileids :

13386471 MUSIC - Add
13386470 HIGH TECH - Add
13386468 FASHION - Add
12842484 HIGH TECH - Overwrite
12842476 MUSIC - Overwrite
12842455 FASHION - Overwrite

3 - I found out that the "VGC" string wasn't recognized as a valid condition by our system. I fixed this.

4 - This error message is displayed when the product reference of the listing (EAN, ISBN, or your own product reference) is missing. In this particular file the EAN was missing in the first field.

5 - It takes up to a couple of days to our image batch to download all the images of new products. I checked this file references and the three images are now displayed.


And I could also see that at 10:39 on 15/02/2011 you submitted a file that fell into the "Too many errors" status. That's because this one line file was a test using 12345678901235 as a value for an EAN. But the system checks EAN validity and because this test EAN wasn't valid the line couldn't be imported.


Once more feel free to mail us at support.pro@priceminister.com if you have any questions.

Ticket IMP-8076 was created for this issue.

Regards,
Commentaire de Laurent Payot [ 17/févr./11 16:14 ]
OK pour le pro:



De : testing@esellerpro [mailto:testing@esellerpro.com]
Envoyé : jeudi 17 février 2011 15:49
À : 'Support Pro'; Testing
Cc : Julien Buhagiar
Objet : RE: eSellerpro - Testing - IMP-8076

Laurent,
Thank you for your swift and comprehensive reply.

Regards

Barry


eSellerPro Testing Department

Commentaire de Laurent Payot [ 24/févr./11 09:55 ]
Analysé problème + tout réexpliqué WS au pro + créé 4 mappingalias + créé 2 profileid :


De : Support Pro [mailto:support.pro@priceminister.com]
Envoyé : mercredi 23 février 2011 19:10
À : support@starsellersworld.com
Cc : 'Gael Seguillon'; carlos.cantoni@priceminister.com; 'Julien Buhagiar'; Daniel Pintamalli
Objet : Starsellerworld/Spangherles account - PriceMinister imports issue - IMP-8126
 
Hello Alexej / Fabian,
 
I’m Laurent from the PriceMinister import team. Here are answers to your two last mails.
 
 
About FTP account:
 
Actually Web Services have been introduced specially to replace validation via FTP. And because sooner or later we will stop using FTP you would have to re-configure your validation system for webservices anyway if you use FTP. Attached to this mail you will find a comprehensive document about Web Services at PriceMinister. You will also find three examples of XML flows returned in the Web Services validation process.
 
Regarding your question about semicolon fields, I did a test with the two different lines and if you look at the error messages in the “Upload my incoming stock data” section of your web interface you will see that the second line is not imported because "The price for this item cannot exceed £255.00.". That’s because you set the Recommended Retail Price to £255.00 whereas your selling price (that’s supposed to be lower than your RRP) is set to £999.99. It has nothing to do with the ending semicolons. I submitted the same line with a selling price of £199.99 and it was successfully imported.
 
 
About the errors you get when trying to update your listings with SKU, RRP, Price, and Quantity :
 
RRP depend of the product, so if you want to modify it you have to send a complete line with all the fields filled to totally update the product. You can still use your FTP account to upload your fashion inventory files, but if you want to use web services your files have to respect the model inside the attached zipped file.
 
If you don’t need to update RPP then you can simply use Web Services of the “mappingalias” type, as described in the attached document. That way you’ll be able to update your inventory with only SKU, price and quantity.
I just up activated your mappingalias profiles, you can now use them (note that you can’t use the FULLADVERT mappingalias because it only works for books and CDs)
 
My colleague Daniel just gave me the file you sent him today. If you want to import electronic products by webservices you also have to respect the model inside the zipped file.
 
Your profileid for fashion is 13558488
 
Your profileid for electronics is 13558451
 
 
Feel free to mail us at support.pro@priceminister.com if you have any questions.
 
 
Ticket IMP-8126 was created for this issue.
 
Regards,
Commentaire de Laurent Payot [ 24/févr./11 10:05 ]
De : de FRA CUST SRV C LVL [starsellersworld.com] [mailto:support@starsellersworld.com]
Envoyé : mercredi 23 février 2011 23:40
À : Support Pro
Cc : Danilo del Giudice
Objet : AW: Starsellerworld/Spangherles account - PriceMinister imports issue - IMP-8126

thanks for the information, that was very helpfull! :)

maybee you have for us an example file of the response xml of the getnewsales call.

Best Regards
Alexej & Fabian

À : 'de FRA CUST SRV C LVL [starsellersworld.com]'
Cc : 'Danilo del Giudice'
Objet : RE: Starsellerworld/Spangherles account - PriceMinister imports issue - IMP-8126

Hello Alexej / Fabian,

Well the file "getnewsalesresult.xml" I transmitted you was a result. In case you can't read the attached file here is the XML content of the attached "getnewsalesresult.xml" :


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <getnewsalesresult xmlns="http://akamai.pminteg.fr/res/schema/getnewsales"
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xsi:schemaLocation="http://akamai.pminteg.fr/res/schema/getnewsales
http://akamai.pminteg.fr/res/schema/getnewsales/getnewsales.2010-09-20.xsd">
<request>
<version>2010-09-20</version>
<user>myseller</user>
</request>
<response>
<lastversion>2010-09-20</lastversion>
<sellerid>16154849</sellerid>
<sales>

<sale>
<purchaseid>94372134</purchaseid>
<purchasedate>02/02/2011-09:57</purchasedate>
<deliveryinformation>
<shippingtype>Recommandé</shippingtype>
<purchaseshippingcostprice>
<amount>5.11</amount>
<currency>EUR</currency>
</purchaseshippingcostprice>
<purchasebuyerlogin>myacheteur</purchasebuyerlogin>

<purchasebuyeremail>dubois@yahoo.com</purchasebuyeremail>
<deliveryaddress>
<civility/>
<lastname><![CDATA[Dubois]]></lastname>
<firstname><![CDATA[Daniel]]></firstname>
<address1><![CDATA[20 rue Louis Morard]]></address1> <address2><![CDATA[]]></address2> <zipcode>75014</zipcode> <city><![CDATA[Paris]]></city> <state><![CDATA[]]></state> <country><![CDATA[France]]></country>
<countryalpha2>FX</countryalpha2>
<phonenumber>06 00 00 00 00</phonenumber> </deliveryaddress> </deliveryinformation> <items>

<item>
<sku><![CDATA[5486424541]]></sku>
<advertpricelisted>
<amount>17.49</amount>
<currency>EUR</currency>
</advertpricelisted>
<itemid>151032328</itemid>
<headline><![CDATA[Castle - Saison 1]]></headline> <itemstatus><![CDATA[TO_CONFIRM]]></itemstatus>
<isnego>N</isnego>
<negotiationcomment/>
<price>
<amount>17.49</amount>
<currency>EUR</currency>
</price>
<itemshippingcostprice>
<amount>5.11</amount>
<currency>EUR</currency>
</itemshippingcostprice>
<isbn/>
<ean>8717418222758</ean>
<paymentstatus><![CDATA[INCOMING]]></paymentstatus>
<sellerscore/>
</item>
</items>
</sale>
</sales>
</response>
</getnewsalesresult>




Regards,

Laurent Payot
PriceMinister imports
support.pro@priceminister.com



[APP-32959] Message d'erreur incorrect suite à l'import d'un image via WS Création: 24/févr./11 17:03  Mise à jour: 25/févr./11 10:48  Résolue: 25/févr./11 10:48

Etat: Résolu
Projet: Application PriceMinister
Composants: Aucune
Affecte la/les version(s): 88.0.0 (VEN-G)
Version(s) corrigée(s): 88.0.0 (VEN-G)

Type: Bogue Priorité: Majeur
Rapporteur: Aurélie Kwiatkowski Attribution: Arnaud Potier
Résolution: Invalid  
Estimation restante: Non spécifié
Temps consacré: Non spécifié
Estimation originale: Non spécifié

Pays:
ESP - Espagne
Site: Integ
Projets PM: Images - Import Lot 2
Navigateur: Tous

 Description   
Je prend un vendeur (basees)

Je prend un advertid qui n'est pas sur une FP pour laquelle basees est un référentiel.

Je lance le WS et je m'attend à avoir un message indiquant "User id {id_du_referentiel} doesn't correspond to advert seller account"

Or, j'ai un message qui dit : The file size exceeds the authorised limit, sachant que la photo uploadée est une image Windows (nénuphars) dont la taille atteind péniblement les 82Ko...

Est-ce normal?

 Commentaires   
Commentaire de Aurélie Kwiatkowski [ 24/févr./11 17:06 ]
https://ws.pminteg.es/stock_ws?action=upload&login=basees&pwd=provence&version=2010-09-20&pid=&aid=57088316&file=C:\Documents%20and%20Settings\All%20Users\Documents\Mes%20images\%C9chantillons%20d%27images\N%E9nuphars.jpg
Commentaire de Arnaud Potier [ 25/févr./11 10:48 ]
Ne fonctionne pas du fait du passage de paramètre dans l'URL.
Vu avec Aurélie, il n'y a pas de problèmes métier si l'on utilise le formulaire de test des webservices.
